Package moulton.scalable.popups

Class Popup

java.lang.Object
moulton.scalable.popups.Popup
Direct Known Subclasses:
ConfirmationPopup, NotificationPopup
public class Popup
extends java.lang.Object
A super class for all pop ups. The MenuManager will give precedence to the popup if there is one set (MenuManager.setPopup(Popup)). The pop up holds a Panel that all its components can be components of. That root panel can be retrived by getBase().

If x or y are left unspecified, then the pop up will be centered on that axis within the container. The popup can draw a background over the other components from the main menu, the color of which is specified by blanketBackground. Any components belonging to the popup that need touch sensitivity can be added to touchCheckList.

Author:
Matthew Moulton

  • Field Details

    • base

      protected Panel base
      The root panel of this popup.
      See Also:
      getBase()

    • touchCheckList

      protected java.util.LinkedList<TouchResponsiveComponent> touchCheckList
      All of the components that need to be check if touched when the mouse moves
      See Also:
      getTouchCheckList(), addTouchResponsiveComponent(TouchResponsiveComponent), removeTouchResponsiveComponent(TouchResponsiveComponent)

    • blanketBackground

      protected java.awt.Color blanketBackground
      The color to draw on top of the other menu that the MenuManager has. Recommended to be translucent.

    • x

      protected java.lang.String x
      The coordinate of the component specified by an algebraic expression. If null (which is default), the popup will be centered on the menu.

    • y

      protected java.lang.String y
      The coordinate of the component specified by an algebraic expression. If null (which is default), the popup will be centered on the menu.

    • width

      protected java.lang.String width
      The dimension of the component specified by an algebraic expression.

    • height

      protected java.lang.String height
      The dimension of the component specified by an algebraic expression.

  • Constructor Details

    • Popup

      public Popup​(java.lang.String width, java.lang.String height, java.awt.Color color)
      Creates a popup and centers it on the space given by the Container
      Parameters:
      width - the width of the popup. Sets width
      height - the height of the popup. Sets height
      color - the color of the popup.

    • Popup

      public Popup​(java.lang.String x, java.lang.String y, java.lang.String width, java.lang.String height, java.awt.Color color)
      Parameters:
      x - the x-position of the popup. If set to null, the popup will be horizontally centered.
      y - the y-position of the popup. If set to null, the popup will be vertically centered.
      width - the width of the popup.
      height - the height of the popup.
      color - the color of the popup.

  • Method Details

    • getBase

      public Panel getBase()
      Returns the Panel that serves as the base level of this popup. This popup is backed up by that Panel. Thus any changes to it may influence this.
      Returns:
      base

    • getBlanketBackground

      public java.awt.Color getBlanketBackground()
      Returns the color used to draw over the other components outside of the popup.
      Returns:
      blanketBackground
      See Also:
      setBlanketBackground(Color)

    • setBlanketBackground

      public void setBlanketBackground​(java.awt.Color background)
      Sets the color used to draw over the other components outside of the popup.
      Parameters:
      background - to set blanketBackground
      See Also:
      getBlanketBackground()

    • getTouchCheckList

      public java.util.LinkedList<TouchResponsiveComponent> getTouchCheckList()
      Returns the list of components that the MenuManager should check for selection each time the mouse moves. For adding and removing components from this list, use addTouchResponsiveComponent(TouchResponsiveComponent) and removeTouchResponsiveComponent(TouchResponsiveComponent) respectively.
      Returns:
      touchCheckList

    • addTouchResponsiveComponent

      public void addTouchResponsiveComponent​(TouchResponsiveComponent comp)
      Adds the component to the list of components to check each time the mouse moves. If the component is later removed from visibility (for example if the panel it is on is removed from the root-tree), then the programmer needs to call removeTouchResponsiveComponent(TouchResponsiveComponent).
      Parameters:
      comp - the component to add on
      See Also:
      removeTouchResponsiveComponent(TouchResponsiveComponent)

    • removeTouchResponsiveComponent

      public void removeTouchResponsiveComponent​(TouchResponsiveComponent comp)
      Removes the specified component from the touch component list.
      Parameters:
      comp - the component to remove
      See Also:
      addTouchResponsiveComponent(TouchResponsiveComponent)

    • render

      public void render​(java.awt.Graphics g, int width, int height)
      Renders the popup by calculating the position of the popup on the screen as according to x, y. width, and height. If blanketBackground is not null, that color is painted over the previous menu components before drawing the popup.
      Parameters:
      g - the graphics object to draw on
      width - the width in pixels of the menu
      height - the height in pixels of the menu
